result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie A. Irving was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $5067.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed.
Credit for 97 days.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days or work performed.

As a Condition of Probation as an ATR w/ credit since the 5/11/16 order to detain.  To complete the Living Free Program..  Huber for employment and treatment allowed.
***Balance stayed on 8/26/16 upon completion of Living Free***

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
May not have contact with Mr S, known drug dealers or users, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Any prescriptions must be approved by the agent.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP, DOC-2259.  Def. has successfully completed the Earned Release Program.  It is ordered that DOC effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  The number of days will be determined by DOC and be based upon actual release date.  Release to be effectuated within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B Schwarz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 6 years WSP concurrent to 14CF713:  3 years initial confinement w/credit for 417 days served; 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP.  No contact w/Mr. Sadowski, known drug dealers or users.  Any prescriptions must be approved by the agent.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions; 1 year conditional jail w/Huber privileges; credit for 97 days served; $5,067.00 total fine/costs (including IID surcharge and $250 DNA surcharge), bond applied, remainder to be paid during period of probation; 36 month revocation of DL; IID; OWI assessment.
WCS report;  Defendant has successfully completed Chapter 85.53 requirements.
to permit Huber release and electronic monitoring.

Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 2/26/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond revoked, deft taken into custody from court; Huber release allowed on ELM.
WCS report;  Defendant has successfully completed Chapter 85.53 requirements.
WCS report;  Defendant has successfully completed Chapter 85.53 requirements.

Final pre-trial on December 11, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Rescheduled from 10/6/14 on the Court's own motion, due to unavailability of a Reserve Judge for the 10/6/14 hearing.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Matt Perz. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 4-9-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.

From WCS.
Def. resumed reporting to WCS on 3-5-14 as directed. To date, all breathalyzers conducted have tested negative for alcohol. Since the Notice of Positive Drug Test submitted to the Court on 8-2-13, no urine samples have been collected. The def. enrolled in AODA treatment through PSC. Provider reports def. was discharged as non-compliant for failure to make her appointments.
